summary: While driving down the Interstate, the engine started knocking, lost power, and came to a stop on the Interstate. I was almost run over by a Tractor-Trailer. A Hero unit showed to push it of the Interstate and transport me and my children to safety. The engine did finally restart, but didn’t have enough power to move and knocked very loudly. Called local KIA Dealer, who told me this is a common problem with 2013 KIA Sportage and it would need a new engine at my expense. It was not included in engine recall. The cost to repair is more than the vehicle is worth. I purchased the vehicle new and was never told this would happen. I am on SSDI and now without a vehicle and can’t afford to buy another car, I can barely afford food for my children.

Was driving my Sportage at 70mph when the car started knocking. I had to pull over as the car began to slow down and I could not shift gears. my mechanic advised that the engine had seized and a replacement was needed. I was advised by the manufacturer that my Vin was not included in the recall even though I’m experiencing the exact recall defects.

The engine in our 2013 Kia Sportage began making a weird clicking noise a few weeks ago. We called the Kia dealership and asked what to do and were informed that our car was NOT listed under the Kia Sportage engine recall for knocking engines. We were told to add additive to our fuel and it would fix the issue. It didn't and the knocking got worse. Soon, it was so bad and the car was moving sluggishly along the road. There were NO warning lights. We had the car towed to a Kia dealership and were informed the engine was BLOWN, but we still have NO warning lights (no check engine light, no low oil light, no overheating light). We had ZERO indication (other than the noise) that there was a catastrophic issue with the engine. This is a car that we use to travel highways with and it put my life and my daughter's life in danger. The Kia dealership is asking us to pay $7000 in order to fix the issue - when it's a KNOWN issue with Kia Sportages. The 2013 Kia Sportage (my car) is currently on the list for recall of this engine and somehow my VIN doesn't register as part of it, even though we have a blown engine, knocking noise, and NO WARNING LIGHTS.

Incident occured early Dec. 2021.While driving at about 20-25 mph, as I approached stop sign, the Kia suddenly started jerking and cut off. Lucky for me the car crossing stopped before they hit us (family of 5 in car)After having my mechanic (he is a pro who owns his own shop with several employees and a good reputation)come to my home (incident happened 3/4 of a mile from home thank goodness) he stated the engine had siezed, I towed it to Kia of Port Charlotte and they stated it was "normal wear and tear"  and want to charge 8500 to fix it. The oil has been changed regularly, (2 weeks prior to incident)and this came out of nowhere- no noises or warning at all. I have since researched KIa and see lots of recalls and law suites on thier cars
Engine locked up without warning or reason.

The contact owns a 2013 Kia Sportage. The contact stated while driving approximately 65 MPH, the vehicle stalled. There were no warning lights illuminated. The vehicle was towed to an independent mechanic who stated that he was unable to repair the vehicle. The contact called the local dealer, but the vehicle was not diagnosed or repaired. The manufacturer was not notified of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 117,000.

While driving my 2013 Kia Sportage at 70 mph from Wisconsin to Duluth MN,  I heard a tapping coming from the engine.  Very quickly, the noise escalated to a very loud knocking.   At this time, I thought my engine was going to blow up while driving.  I was very frightened by this experience.  Then car shut off while I was driving putting myself and those behind me at rick of an accident, however I was able to pull over.  I was alone.  I had no idea what was happening and I was 75 miles from home.   There was no WARNING indicator light to come on in my dashboard to inform me that there was an engine problem.    After I steered my vehicle on the side of the road,  I was able to start the car to get to the nearest gas station for help.  There was no one available to help me.  So I decided to drive my vehicle slowly home. That is when my engine blew-up and I could no longer drive the vehicle.   I contacted KIA for Road Side assistance and they informed me the the tow would cost me near $560.00.   Then I called my mechanic friend for a tow.  After he arrived and looked at the engine, he looked over and under the engine and told me that a rod blew through the engine block.  (Pictures available) My 2013 Kia Sportage was brought to KIA of Duluth the following day for repair.  Kia of Duluth inspected the vehicle and informed me that a Knock Sensor Detection recall was not preformed on my vehicle and that my 100,000 mile Warranty had expired as I had 105,812 upon arrival.  On October 27, 2021 I submitted a Claim to Kia Engine Settlement and have received no satisfaction.  Further I was informed that I would be eligible for Towing and Rental Cost by Kia Consumer Affairs and KIA Engine  and most resent been denied that as well.   My 2013 Kia Sportage was valued at 10, 900 dollars when this happened on September 14th, 2021.   I received no reimbursement.  I have paid $2192.00 in towing and rental cost.  This resulted in me purchasing a new vehicle.

Car engine started making a loud knocking / tapping noise, car shut off while driving down the road at 40 mph, I had to replace the battery, car started back up but is still knocking / tapping. No warning lights came up, I have 112,000 miles on it, I keep the maintenance up on it, I don't run it hard, I take car of it because I Love My car, I have NEVER had any issues before this. I did not receive a recall on it, but, there is two recalls listed on for it, this issue is one of the two recalls.

During accelerating into highway traffic the engine shutoff suddenly and left us without power, which nearly resulted in my wife and I being killed by two separate tractor trailers that by the grace of god were able to swerve and miss rear-ending our car at 60 MPH. The car could not be restarted. After further inspection by the dealer this was a result of catastrophic engine failure due to connecting rod bearing failure. This has been a known issue with the KIA 2.4 liter engine. The bigger issue is that we were nearly killed by a known problem that was not addressed when it was identified and instead was left to WAIT to occur, which could have resulted in death(s).   I cannot believe that KIA was allowed to proceed in the direction they were once this problem was identified.   Our car has now been with KIA for nearly 8 weeks waiting to be repaired and they are now telling us that many of the old parts (Eg, Pistons) will be used when they rebuild the engine, verse replacing the entire engine. Every mechanic we have spoken with has stated this is incorrect procedure that will result in numerous problems down the road. This is not an acceptable solution to resolve a long term known safety issue.

Driving at 75 mph, took foot off accelerator, and when placing foot back on accelerator, started losing power and had started to have a strong knocking sound then stalled. Was able to get started with the loud knock and get to a "safer" location. NO check engine lights. Car was running smooth prior to this with all current maintenance upkeep. Full daily driver. Will still start and will drive under 1500 rpm but shakes and stalls above 1500 rpm. Approx 122k miles

While driving the car in local traffic at approximately 50 miles per hour the car started losing power and immediately started to have a strong knocking sound and then stalled. Fortunately no other vehicles were present. I believe the battery light came on but it happened so quickly. The car was running fine up to that point with no issue. The car has approximately 73000 miles so as anyone can see it has not been driven hard over 8 years. It was towed to Midas where the car was started and immediately a very loud knocking sound occurred. On further inspection it was documented as catastrophic engine failure. It was towed to my home where it sits with a broken engine. It is available for inspection from the manufacturer. I just had my brakes changed and the general inspection of the overall vehicle was said to be very good and the rest of the car interior and exterior is in near excellent condition.

The contact owns a 2013 KIA Sportage. The contact stated while driving 80 MPH, the vehicle shut-off without warning. The contact pulled to the shoulder of the highway and had the vehicle towed to her home. The contact stated that a knocking noise would emit from the vehicle after multiple failed attempts to restart the engine. Upon investigation, the contact discovered NHTSA Campaign Number: 17V224000 (Engine and Engine Cooling) which she linked to the failure. The dealer and the manufacturer were notified of the failure and informed her that her vehicle was not under recall. The vehicle had yet to be repaired. The failure mileage was approximately 109,000.

The engine seized with only 83k miles on it. For some reason it is not covered under the massive KIA engine recall despite overwhelming amount of information online saying this is a worldwide problem.

The engine locked up on the vehicle while I was driving it. It just quit running in the  middle of driving 60 mph traffic. I was on the expressway in the fast lane of traffic and it was in mid-afternoon traffic. No warning lights were on before it shut down. Vehicle was well maintained and taken care of and garage kept. It is available for inspection

The contact owns a 2013 Kia Sportage. The contact stated that while stopped at a stop light, the vehicle was making abnormal sounds however, the contact was able to drive the vehicle to her residence. The vehicle was taken to an independent mechanic and diagnosed with engine failure. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was not made aware of the failure. The approximate failure mileage was 85,000.

The contact owns a 2013 Kia Sportage. The contact stated while driving 73 mph, she heard an abnormal sound coming from the engine. There was no warning light illuminated. The contact parked on the side of the roadway and saw smoke coming from under the hood. The contact opened the hood and saw fire around the engine. The contact stated that her boyfriend extinguished the fire with bottles of water she had in the vehicle. The police and fire department were called to the scene. A fire report was filed. The contact was not aware of a police report being filed. There was no injury sustained. The vehicle was not drivable. The vehicle was towed to two independent mechanics and remained at the second location. The vehicle was not diagnosed nor repaired. A dealer was not contacted. Upon investigation, the contact associated the failure with NHTSA Campaign Number: 18V907000 (Fuel System, Gasoline, Engine) however, the VIN was not included. The manufacturer had been informed of the failure. The failure mileage was approximately 137,000.

Car stopped while at a stop light.  There was traffic all around.  We had it towed.  Airport Kia ([XXX]) states it needs a new engine.   They said they could not repair on a recall or product improvement because it had been too long.  I spoke with Kia Corporate and they said there was a software update in April 2021 that was designed to (Product Improvement) to fix the engine issue.  Once the software update was done the car would get a 15 year warranty.  We did not receive information regarding the update or any other recall notices.  We found out only when the engine quit.  The car was still tied to the original owner @ Kia Corporate (per their records)  - although they had [XXX] and her address as the Registered Driver.  They did not contact [XXX].  Neither the dealership or corporate will help us with this issue.  The engine replacement will be $6000.00.  INFORMATION Redacted PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

Bought a 2013 Kia Sportage on July 16, 2021 form Holman Cadillac in Mt Laurel, NJ 08054. Two days later the check engine light appeared. Took it back to the dealer but they could not fix it. Holman sent it to a Kia Auto Shop. Car has been in the shop for 3 days. We are afraid it could be associated to the engine issues that have plagued the Kia vehicles.
Car stopped running while driving and the engine seized and locked up. Had my mechanic look at it. Put myself and others at risk being in traffic. No problems prior and no warning lamps whatsoever.

The contact's daughter owns a 2013 Kia Sportage. The contact stated that while his daughter was driving 10 mph, the vehicle loss motive power without warning. The vehicle was towed to the contact's friend's residence, who works as an independent mechanic, and diagnosed the vehicle with an engine. The battery, alternator, and starter were replaced however, the failure recurred. The dealer was made aware of the failure and referred the contact to the manufacturer. The vehicle was not repaired. The manufacturer was made aware of the failure and informed the contact that the Vin was not included in NHTSA Campaign Number: 17V224000 (Engine and Engine Cooling). The contact was informed that since the oxygen sensor recall was not repaired the manufacturer would not cover the engine repair. The approximate failure mileage was 120,000.

I was driving from Abilene, Texas to San Antonio, Texas, when coming up a hill, all of a sudden, I hear something pop, and then right after a loud ticking noise.  I lost acceleration, and brought it down from 75mph, to about 15-20mph in order to pull over.  My car then needed to be towed into Fredericksburg, and then was towed to a shop in San Antonio, Texas.  After the shop reviewed what had happened, they said it was a bearing, and that there was a recall for that particular year and model. After calling KIA, they said they could not help me, as my VIN was not included in that recall; even though the recall (SC147) is for the 2011-2014 KIA Optima, Sorento and the Sportage.  I was told that it only affected the 2.0L engine, and not my 2.4L engine.  This information, along with my VIN # needs to be added to the RECALL, as it is the 'same' issue with all of those other vehicles.  KIA does not want to help or assist.  I asked for someone else, a high supervisor, but was denied.  There were no warnings given, or prior symptoms before the failure.  I was totally taken by surprise when this happened to me in the middle of no where.
Sudden Engine knocking. Engine needs replacing. Recall placed for my vehicle type but not my specific vehicle.

I was driving on Hwy 100 in Fairview,Tn and my Kia Sportage just stop running and I coasted off the Hwy in a front yard. I was on a two lane Hwy. very Scary had to tow car into a repair shop in Fairview but they said found engine locked up and then Kia said to have it towed to a dealership in Franklin, Tn. I have never had this happen ever in any vehicle. I’m 70 years old and need this engine to be paid for.   I have two tow cost and a diag. From Hall Repair Shop.

Just purchased Kia Sportage 2013 a few weeks ago and everything was just find under under the hood. Yesterday I was driving to work and the car just stalled on me on the highway and started smoking. No warning signs! By the grace of god, i was able to enter to the right lane without losing my live as many were all driving fast around me as I was trying to make it to the side. When I was able to park and I noticed that the oil was pouring out from the bottom.

Traveling at highway speeds, the following happened. 2013 KIA Sportage purchased July 2019 -Started to lose power and loud knocking noise from engine (No check engine light and coolant temps average to make me aware of a problem). The lack and loss of power in any situation with other vehicle at high rates of speed has the possibility of cause severe accidents, casualties, and endangering large groups of individuals. -Pulled off to the shoulder of the highway due to lack of power and car shaking (Very high risk of getting hit). -Had car towed to AAA approved (Kwik Kar). -Mechanic called and mentioned that this specific engine (2.0L and 2.4L) is that the oil pump  has defects and will starve the engine of oil with no signs (Such as check engine light). -Estimated cost of repair $8000. -I called KIA and the response was "since I did not take my vehicle in when there was a product improvement campaign that KIA would not repair/replace the engine due to my negligence" (I was never contacted about this "Campaign") and when I would check the KIA website (I checked every 3 months) there were and still are no recalls specific for my VIN.

The contact owns a 2013 Kia Sportage. The contact stated while driving at 70 mph, the engine ceased. There was no warning light illuminated. The vehicle was towed to an independent mechanic where it was diagnosed with the engine needing to be replaced. The vehicle was not repaired. The contact was relating the failure to NHTSA campaign number: 17V224000 (Engine and Engine Cooling). The manufacturer had been informed of the failure and informed the contact that the Vin was not under recall. The failure mileage was approximately 135,000.

I WAS DRIVING MY 2013 KIA SPORTAGE ON THE FREEWAY AND MY CAR JUST DIED ON ME. WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER AND FOUND OUT BY MECHANIC THAT MY ENGINE HAD SEIZED . HE SAID I NEEDED TO TELL KIA BECAUSE OF ALL THE RECALLS THEY HAD FOR 2013 VEHICLES. MY CAR WAS NOT PART OF THE RECALL.
ENGINE FAILED DUE TO BEARING FAILURE

WHEN I WAS DRIVING ON THE FREEWAY, MY ENGINE SEIZED ON ME. LUCKILY I WAS ABLE TO GLIDE OFF TO THE SIDE WITHOUT BEING HIT. I CONTACTED THE KIA CORPORATION WHICH IS A HORRIBLY RAN BUSINESS. AFTER LETTING THEM KNOW I WOULD CONTACT A LAWYER IF THEY DIDN'T FIX THE PROBLEM, THEY DECIDED TO REPLACE THE ENGINE. NOT CALLING IT A RECALL, THOUGH IT IS DOING THE EXACT SAME THING THE RECALL STATED. THEY ARE MAKING ME PAY 3000.00 LABOR COSTS TO FIX MY VEHICLE, AND I BELIEVE THEY SHOULD BE PAYING FOR THE WHOLE THING! MY CAR HAS BEEN AT THE DEALERSHIP FOR TWO MONTHS NOW AND STILL ISINT FIXED!

MY HUSBAND WAS RETURNING HOME TO OREGON FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA AND WAS DRIVING 50 MPH ON THE FREEWAY WHEN THE CAR (2013 KIA SPORTAGE) BEGAN MAKING LOUD KNOCKING NOISES AND IMMEDIATELY LOST POWER. HE WAS IN THE MIDDLE LANE OF THE FREEWAY WHEN IT LOST POWER, MAKING IT INCREDIBLY UNSAFE AND PUTTING HIM IN DANGER BECAUSE THE PEOPLE BEHIND HIM HAD TO SLAM ON THEIR BRAKES TO AVOID REAR-ENDING HIM. IT WAS ALSO VERY DANGEROUS TO TRY AND MOVE THE CAR OFF OF THE FREEWAY WITH OTHER CARS GOING BY AT 50+ MPH. FORTUNATELY, HE WAS ABLE TO GET THE CAR OFF THE FREEWAY AND PULLED OVER WHEREUPON THE CAR DIED. HE TRIED STARTING IT AGAIN AND IT STILL HAD THE VERY LOUD KNOCKING NOISE AND WOULD NOT STAY ON. ALL OF THE WARNING LIGHTS ON THE DASH LIT UP AND THE CHECK ENGINE LIGHT STAYED ON AFTER HE HAD TURNED THE CAR OFF AND THEN BACK ON. AFTER WAITING FOR 3 HOURS FOR A TOW, THE CAR WAS FINALLY TOWED TO THE CLOSEST DEALER HILLTOP KIA IN RICHMOND CA. MY HUSBAND HAD TO WAIT FOR CLOSE TO A WEEK TO GET THE DEALER TO LOOK AT THE CAR AND ONCE THEY DID, THEY CAME BACK WITH AN $11,000 ESTIMATE STATING THAT THE CAR NEEDED THE ENGINE REPLACED, IT WAS OUT OF WARRANTY BECAUSE THE 100,000 MILE WARRANTY ONLY APPLIED TO THE ORIGINAL OWNER, THERE WAS NO RECALL ON THIS CAR AND KIA WOULD NOT REPLACE THE ENGINE FREE OF COST. WE HAVE LEARNED THAT THE ENGINE IN THIS CAR HAS A MANUFACTURER'S DEFECT AND THAT KIA IS NOT REPLACING THESE EVEN THOUGH THEY KNOW IT'S A DEFECT OF THEIR OWN MAKING. THIS HAS BEEN INCREDIBLY STRESSFUL BECAUSE THE CAR ONLY HAD 62,000 MILES ON IT, AND WE KEPT UP WITH ALL OF THE MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS. WE STILL OWE $3500 ON A CAR THAT WE CAN'T EVEN DRIVE, THE LOWEST WE'VE BEEN QUOTED TO GET IT RUNNING AGAIN IS $5000 WHICH MEANS THAT THE COST OF FIXING IT IS EQUAL TO OR MORE THAN THE RESALE VALUE OF THE CAR.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 KIA SPORTAGE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 70 MPH, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO ACCELERATE. THE CHECK ENGINE AND BATTERY WARNING LIGHTS WERE ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT EXITED THE FREEWAY AND STOPPED BY A NEARBY PARKING LOT. THE CONTACT FELT THAT THE VEHICLE WAS UNSAFE TO DRIVE AND HAD THE VEHICLE TOWED TO HER RESIDENCE. THE CONTACT'S FATHER INSPECTED THE VEHICLE AND NOTICED THAT THERE WAS AN ABNORMAL SOUND COMING FROM THE ENGINE. STAFFORD KIA OF FREDERICKSBURG (5204 JEFFERSON DAVIS HIGHWAY, FREDERICKSBURG, VA 22408, (888)736-2604) WAS CONTACTED BY PHONE HOWEVER, THE CALL GOT DISCONNECTED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED NOR REPAIRED. THE CONTACT MENTIONED NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V224000 (ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING) AS A POSSIBLE SOLUTION TO THE FAILURE HOWEVER, THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE AND PROVIDED THE CONTACT WITH A CASE NUMBER. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 130,000.
MY 2013 KIA SPORTAGE CAUGHT FIRE WHILE ON THE INTERSTATE  THE GAS PEDAL DIDNT WORK I PULLED OVER AND THE CAR WAS SMOKING BECAUSE IT WAS ON FIRE
CLOCK SPRING MALFUNCTIONED, REPLACED X2, THEN MAT FAILED IN THE PASSENGER SEAT. CAR HAS NEVER BEEN IN AN ACCIDENT. STAYED IN DRIVEWAY. SELDOM USED TOTAL MILAGE 111,659

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 KIA SPORTAGE. THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 70 MPH, THE RPM STARTED FLUCTUATING WITH SEVERAL UNKNOWN WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE STARTED TO DECELERATE. THE CONTACT PULLED OVER TO THE SHOULDER OF THE ROADWAY AND TURNED OFF THE VEHICLE. THE VEHICLE FAILED TO RESTART. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC TO BE DIAGNOSED. THE MECHANIC STATED THAT ALL THE ENGINE OIL HAD LEAKED OUT OF THE ENGINE. THE VEHICLE WAS THEN TOWED TO NALLEY KIA (7849 MALL PKWY, LITHONIA, GA 30038) TO BE DIAGNOSED. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE ENGINE NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 124,344. *DT

AT A FREEWAY OFF RAMP STOP SIGN MY 2013, KIA SPORTAGE ENGINE DIED AND COULD NOT BE RESTARTED.THERE ARE 70,000 MILES ON IT. THE CAR WAS TOWED TO MY MECHANIC. INVESTIGATION DETERMINED THAT THE MOTOR BEARINGS WERE DEFECTIVE. THIS IS THE EXACT PROBLEM FOR WHICH KIA IS HAVING A RECALL. KIA DENIED MY CLAIM SAYING MY VIN # WAS NOT ONE APPROVED FOR RECALL.THEY CLAIM THAT MY CAR WAS NOT MANUFACTURED AT THE ASSEMBLY PLANT WHERE THE DEFECTS OCCURRED. REGARDLESS OF WHERE MY CAR WAS ASSEMBLED, MOTOR BEARING FAILURE WITH ONLY 70,000 MILES IS KIA'S FAULT. THE EMOTIONAL STRESS IS SEVERE. KIA'S STONEWALLING IS VERY FRUSTRATING AND THE EXPENSE (APPROXIMATELY $6,000) IS BACKBREAKING.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 KIA SPORTAGE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE HIS WIFE WAS DRIVING AT LOW SPEEDS IN TRAFFIC, SEVERAL UNKNOWN WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED, AND THE VEHICLE STALLED. THE CONTACT'S WIFE ATTEMPTED TO RESTART THE VEHICLE HOWEVER, THE VEHICLE FAILED TO RESTART. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO YOUNGBLOOD KIA (3525 S CAMPBELL AVE, SPRINGFIELD, MO 65807, (866) 825-9532) AND DIAGNOSED HOWEVER, THE MECHANIC WAS UNABLE TO DUPLICATE THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE CONTACT MENTIONED NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 17V224000 (ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING) AS A POSSIBLE SOLUTION TO THE FAILURE HOWEVER, THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE APPROXIMATELY 70,000. THE VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED.

I WAS DRIVING HOME ON THE HIGHWAY AT APPROXIMATELY 60-65 MPH, WHEN A LOUD KNOCKING NOISE STARTED FROM UNDER THE HOOD OF THE CAR. THE CAR SUDDENLY DIED AND WE WERE ABLE TO MERGE OUT OF TRAFFIC. ONCE THE CAR DIED THE ENGINE LIGHT TURNED ON. THE CAR HAS 106,000 MILES. PRIOR TO THIS INCIDENT IT HAD BEEN SERVICED REGULARLY, HAD NO LIGHTS ON, NO LEAKAGE AND NOTHING TO INDICATE THERE WAS OR WOULD BE A PROBLEM WITH THE ENGINE. I CALLED KIA COORPERATE WHO CLAIMS THIS SPECIFIC VIN WAS NOT PART OF THE 2013 KIA SPORTAGE ENGINE RECALLS. THERE ARE 42 PAGES OF CONSUMER COMPLAINTS WITH THIS ALMOST IDENTICAL SCENARIO. KIA SHOULD BE ASHAMED OF WHAT THEY ARE DOING TO PEOPLE. THIS IS A HUGE SAFETY HAZARD WITH THE VEHICLE DYING SUDDENLY AT FAST SPEEDS AND A HUGE FINANCIAL BURDEN. I AM BEING QUOTED MORE THEN THE VALUE OF THE CAR TO REPLACE IT WITH A USED ENGINE. WHICH VERY CLEARLY WILL ALSO HAVE ISSUES AS THESE ENGINES ARE FAULTY.

MY WIFE WAS DRIVING IN TRAFFIC AND VEHICLE LOST POWER TO EVERYTHING .LUCKILY SHE WAS IN A POSITION TO PULL INTO A PARKING LOT. AFTER THE VEHICLE STOPPED SHE WAS ABLE TO START IT AGAIN . THIS HAPPENED TO HER TWICE WHILE TRYING TO GET HOME. I TOLD HER TO GET IT HOME AND MAKE A SERVICE APPOINTMENT . SHE TOLD SERVICE DEPARTMENT THAT SINCE IT WAS IN WE WANTED ALL RECALLS DEALT WITH. THEY ONLY FOUND TWO RECALLS( CHARCOAL CANISTER/ UNDERCOATING) WE HAD THEM RUN A DIAGNOSTIC TEST $150 AND WE WERE TOLD THEY FOUND NOTHING. ON THE RETURN TRIP FROM THE SERVICE DEPARTMENT MY WIFE CALKS AGAIN AND SAID THE  VEHICLE COMPLETELY SHUT DOWN AGAIN! I WENT TO SEE IF I COULD HELP AND FOUND THE VEHICLE WITH A TRAIL OF OIL BEHIND IT AND ABOUT 3 QUARTS OF OIL UNDERNEATH.  I  CALLED THE DEALERSHIP AND THEY SAID TO TOW IT TO THEM. THE NEXT MORNING I CALL AND DECIDED TO MAKE A IN PERSON VISIT TO SPEAK WITH THE SERVICE MANAGER. AFTER I TELL HIM WHAT HAPPENED  HE MAKES NO MENTION OF ANY ENGINE RECALL . I INFORMED HIM THERE WAS WITH THE ENGINE. THEN HE TELLS ME THERE IS A RECALL WITH THE 2.4 GDI ENGINES AND NOT FIR THE  2.4 MPI ENGINES. THIS SPORTAGE HAS 70K MILES ON IT. STILL PENDING A CALL BACK ABOUT WHAT THEY DISCOVER THE ENGINE MAY BE REPLACED OR NOT. THIS NEEDS FURTHER INVESTIGATION ABOUT THE 2.4 MPI BEING INCLUDED IN RECALLS.

MY BOYFRIEND AND I WERE  ON MY WAY TO GATLINBURG FOR MY BIRTHDAY WEEKEND. JUST MADE IT INTO KNOXVILLE WHEN MY DASHBOARD LIGHTS CAME ON AND THE ENGINE MADE A LOUD KNOCKING NOISE AND STOPPED. WE BARELY MADE IT TO THE SIDE OF THE INTERSTATE (THE LEFT LANE OF I-75 IN KNOXVILLE). MY BOYFRIEND STATED THAT THE ENGINE JUST THREW A ROD. WE WAITED 2 HOURS FOR A TOW TRUCK WITH TDOT BEHIND US FOR AN HOUR AND 1/2 FOR THAT. THERE WAS OIL ALL OVER THE ROAD. WE FINALLY GOT TOWED TO THE KIA CLOSEST TO US. THEY RAN MY VIN AND STATED THAT ISN'T PART OF THE RECALL BECAUSE MY ENGINE ISN'T THE GDI ENGINE. SO, EVEN THOUGH 2013 KIA SPORTAGES ARE ALL HAVING ENGINE FAILURE WITHOUT WARNING IN POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS SITUATIONS FOR ALL OF KIA'S CUSTOMERS, KIA IS DOING NOTHING ABOUT IT. MY BOYFRIEND WORKS AS A MECHANIC AND SUBMITTED A PA AND IT WAS DENIED AS WELL. IF THERE ARE MORE THAN 100 CUSTOMER'S HAVING ISSUES WITH THE SAME ENGINE, THEN THERE SHOULD BE A RECALL. THIS LOOKS BAD ON KIA, AND IT LOOKS BAD ON THE NHTSA FOR NOT ISSUING THE RECALL DUE TO SAFETY. HAD ANY OF THE NUMEROUS 250 COMPLAINTS I HAVE SEEN SO FAR NOT BEEN ABLE TO GET OUT OF THE ROAD, DUE TO NO WARNING, THEN I'M SURE THERE WOULD BE A RECALL. BUT IT SHOULDN'T HAVE TO COME TO DEATH BEFORE A RECALL IS ISSUED.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2013 KIA SPORTAGE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING APPROXIMATELY 65 MPH, THE VEHICLE STALLED WITH THE CHECK ENGINE WARNING LIGHT ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE COASTED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD AND SHIFTED INTO PARK. THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO AN INDEPENDENT MECHANIC TO BE DIAGNOSED. THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT METAL DEBRIS WAS FOUND IN THE ENGINE. THE CONTACT CONTACTED OAKES KIA (2900 BURLINGTON ST, NORTH KANSAS CITY, MO 64116, (816) 474-2900) AND WAS INFORMED THAT THERE WAS A TOTAL ENGINE LOSS DUE TO METAL DEBRIS FOUND IN THE ENGINE WHICH CREATED A HOLE IN THE PISTON. THE DEALER HAD NOT DIAGNOSED NOR REPAIRED THE VEHICLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 94,000.
I WAS OUT DRIVING MY CAR ONE DAY AND THE WINDOW SWITCH STARTED ACTING UP,THE RADIO SHUT OFF, THE AC COMPRESSOR AND THE RADIATOR FAN STOPPED WORKING AT THE SAME TIME WHILE DRIVING IN MOTION.

MY FAMILY AND I WERE DRIVING ON HIGHWAY 191 BY MILEPOST 93 WHEN ALL OF A SUDDEN THE ENGINE STARTED MAKING A SLIGHT WHIRLING NOISE AND STARTED TO LOSE POWER.  WE WERE ASCENDING A LITTLE HILL AND ALMOST DIDN'T MAKE IT UP THE HILL.  WE HAD TO PULL OVER AND GET OFF THE ROAD AS FAR AS WE CAN.  THE PLACE WHERE THE ENGINE DECIDED TO GIVE US PROBLEMS WAS NEAR A VERY DANGEROUS BLIND SPOT.  AS THE KIA SLOWED DOWN, A SEMI ALMOST REARED ENDED US BECAUSE OF THE SUDDEN DECELERATING SPEED.  THERE WAS NO SUDDEN VIBRATION OR ANYTHING ELSE OUT OF THE ORDINARY.  I HAD TO CALL THE SAN JUAN COUNTY SHERIFF'S DISPATCH UNIT TO GET SOME ASSISTANCE. I WAS DRIVING TO MISSOURI THERE WAS A KNOCKING FROM MY CAR, I TRIED PUSHING ON THE GAS BUT IT WOULDN'T LET THE GASKET TO THE ENGINE SO IT WOULDN'T LET ME CONTINUE DRIVING. I HAD TO PULL OVER AND MY DAD AND BROTHER CAME TO TOW IT TO MY DADS TOWN MECHANIC HE SAID THE BARRINGS WENT OUT ON THE CRANK SHAFT. I WAS IN THE INTERSTATE. I FOUND OUT THERE IS A RECALL #17V-224 (METAL DEBRIS MAY HAVE BEEN GENERATED FROM FACTORY MACHINING OPERATIONS AS PART OF THE MANUFACTURING OF THE ENGINE CRANKSHAFT WHICH MAY NOT HAVE BEEN COMPLETELY REMOVED FROM THE CRANKSHAFT'S OIL PASSAGES DURING THE CLEANING PROCESS. IN ADDITION, THE MACHINING PROCESSES OF THE CRANKPINS CAUSED AN UNEVEN SURFACE ROUGHNESS. AS A RESULT, THE METAL DEBRIS AND UNEVEN SURFACE ROUGHNESS CAN RESTRICT OIL FLOW TO THE BEARINGS, THEREBY INCREASING BEARING TEMPERATURES CAUSING PREMATURE BEARING WEAR. A WORN CONNECTING ROD BEARING WILL PRODUCE A CYCLIC KNOCKING NOISE FROM THE ENGINE AND MAY ALSO RESULT IN THE ILLUMINATION OF THE ENGINE WARNING LAMP AND/OR OIL PRESSURE LAMP IN THE INSTRUMENT PANEL. IF THE WARNINGS ARE IGNORED AND THE VEHICLE IS CONTINUED THE CRANK SHAFT GOING OUT AND IT COULD START A FIRE.) THIS IS EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED TO MY CAR. I KNOW THE VIN # AND THE RECALL NUMBER DOES NOT MATCH. I DON'T UNDERSTAND FROM WHAT I READ THAT THERE IS A RECALL BUT NOT FOR MY VEHICLE EVEN THOUGH IT SAYS 2011 TO 2013 KIA SPORTAGE. MY ENGINE HASS TO BE REBUILT THE PARTS ALONE ARE $2800 THEN IT COST THE MECHANIC TO FIX MY CAR SO IT'S GOING TO COST A LITTLE OVER OR UNDER 5000$ I ONLY OWE 4000$. IF I WOULD'VE KNOWN THIS I WOULD'VE TRADED MY CAR IN FOR THE NEW KIA SPORTAGE. I REALLY HOPE THAT SOMEONE CAN GET A HOLD OF ME ABOUT THIS I DON'T SEE WHY I HAVE TO SPEND 5000 WHEN THERE WAS A RECALL ON EXACTLY WHAT HAPPENED TO MY VEHICLE.

THERE IS CURRENTLY A CLASS ACTION LAWSUIT SETTLEMENT IN PLACE FOR ISSUES RELATED TO CONNECTING ROD BEARING WEAR LEADING TO ENGINE FAILURE RESULTING IN THE ENGINE SEIZING INCREASING THE RISK OF CRASH, DAMAGED PISTONS, AND A CRACKED ENGINE BLOCK WITH THE ENGINES IN 2011-2019 KIA SPORTAGES EQUIPPED WITH A 2.0L OR 2.4L GASOLINE DIRECT INJECTION ENGINE.(ENGINE FAILURE AND FIRE).I HAVE A 2013 2.4L.   (RECALL NUMBER 17V224000. KIA'S NUMBER FOR THIS RECALL IS SC147) ALTHOUGH ACCORDING TO THE KIA WEBSITE, MY VIN WAS NOT INCLUDED FOR SOME UNKNOWN REASON. TERMS OF THE SETTLEMENT INCLUDE BUT NOT LIMITED TO FREE INSPECTION AND REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF DAMAGED ENGINES, LIFETIME WARRANTY FOR SHORT BLOCK ASSEMBLY REPAIRS, FREE INSTALLATION OF THE KNOCK SENSOR DETECTION SYSTEM SOFTWARE UPDATE (FROM A PREVIOUS RECALL 17V-224), AS WELL AS GOODWILL COMPENSATION. AT 97,XXX MILES, THE CONNECTING ROD BEARINGS FAILED AND THE ENGINE SEIZED. THE FAILURE RUPTURED THE OIL PAN, SPRAYING OIL ON THE ENGINE, EXHAUST HEADERS, AND THE ROAD. THE ENGINE LOST POWER AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS AND THE VEHICLE COASTED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD. THE FAILURE WAS SUDDEN WITHOUT ANY WARNING LIGHTS, NOISE, OR PERFORMANCE LOSS PRIOR TO THE FAILURE.    THIS FAILURE SEEMS SIMILAR TO OTHER FAILURES WITH KIA AND HYUNDAI ENGINES, HOWEVER THIS SPECIFIC ENGINE WAS NOT LISTED IN A NHTSA RECALL. KIA HAS REFUSED TO WARRANTY THE FAILURE, STATING IT WAS NOT "DUE TO A MANUFACTURING DEFECT". THE ENGINE MODEL IS A 2.4L DOHC MPI THETA-II. OTHER THETA-II ENGINES HAVE BEEN RECALLED, JUST NOT THIS VERY SPECIFIC TYPE.

MY 2013 KIA SPORTAGE WITH 96,807 MILES STALLED WHILE DRIVING ON A VERY BUSY, FAST-MOVING STREET. THE CAR BEGAN TO STUTTER, LOSE ACCELERATION, AND A KNOCKING SOUND STARTED TO COME FROM THE ENGINE. PER THE DIAGNOSIS FROM MY MECHANIC, UPON TEAR DOWN OF ENGINE THE MAIN BEARINGS HAD SPUN CAUSING EXCESSIVE PLAY ON THE PISTONS ALLOWING THEM TO HIT ON THE ENGINE WALL CAUSING THE KNOCKING.    DURING THIS PROCESS, WE LEARNED THE GDI ENGINES WERE RECALLED BUT THE THETA ENGINES WERE NOT, FOR SOME REASON. EVEN THOUGH THE ISSUES ARE THE SAME. WE ALSO LEARNED THE THETA ENGINES FOR REPLACEMENT ARE IMPOSSIBLE TO FIND BECAUSE (1) THE ENGINES WERE DISCONTINUED AND (2) THE ISSUE IS COMMON AND SO MANY PEOPLE ARE NEEDING NEW ENGINES.    WE HAD TO REPLACE THE ENGINE, WHICH COST $7,000 (DUE TO THE MECHANIC FINDING ONLY ONE USED ENGINE AVAILABLE FOR REPLACEMENT - AT THE COST OF OVER $5,000 FOR THE ENGINE ALONE). THE CAR RUNS NORMAL NOW, BUT WE ARE OBVIOUSLY CONCERNED THE REPLACEMENT ENGINE WILL HAVE THE SAME ISSUE AND FAIL, GIVEN HOW OFTEN THIS IS OCCURRING WITH THESE ENGINES.    KIA NEEDS TO ACKNOWLEDGE THIS ISSUE WITH THE THETA ENGINES, AND REIMBURSE CUSTOMERS WHO HAVE NO OTHER CHOICE BUT TO FIX THEIR CAR. components: ENGINE AND ENGINE COOLING,FUEL SYSTEM, GASOLINE
summary: WE EXPERIENCE AN INTERMITTENT RAW GASOLINE SMELL IN THE INTERIOR CABIN OF THE VEHICLE.  THIS PROBLEM STARTED A FEW WEEKS AFTER PURCHASING THE VEHICLE AND HAS PERSISTED EVER SINCE DESPITE 3 REPAIR ATTEMPTS AT KIA DEALERSHIPS (22AUG2012, 07JAN2013, 30JAN2013).  BECAUSE IT IS INTERMITTENT (OCCURRING ONCE OR TWICE EVERY COUPLE WEEKS) AND WITHOUT AN OBVIOUS PATTERN, THE DEALERSHIPS HAVE BEEN UNABLE TO REPRODUCE THE SMELL ON THE DAYS WE'VE BROUGHT THE VEHICLE IN.  ON THE 3RD REPAIR VISIT (30JAN2013), THE TECHNICIAN WAS "UNABLE TO VERIFY SMELL, BUT INSPECTED AND FOUND FUEL AROUND INTAKE AT THE FUEL INJECTOR BASES."  THEY REPLACED O-RINGS TO ATTEMPT TO FIX THE ISSUE.  FOR A WEEK OR SO WE THOUGHT THE ISSUE WAS FIXED, BUT SINCE THE 3RD VISIT HAVE ON AT LEAST FOUR OCCASIONS NOTICED A PROMINENT RAW GASOLINE SMELL IN THE CABIN.  THE CLOSEST TO A PATTERN THAT WE'VE NOTICED IS THAT ON DAYS WHEN THE SMELL OCCURS, IT IS STRONGEST AND MOST OBVIOUS WHEN THE VEHICLE IS IDLING WITH THE HEATER/AC FAN ON.  WE ALSO THINK, BUT ARE NOT SURE, THAT THERE MAY BE A CORRELATION WITH DAYS INVOLVING PRECIPITATION (SNOW/RAIN).  *TR
